result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Paul James MOOR was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes transfer to Walworth County Jail.  If defendant is eligible for electronic monitoring and meets guidelines, Court deems defendant eligible.  Court authorizes out-of-county and out-of-state travel for employment and counseling purposes.
Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
Count 1, OWI 4th within 5 years - Guilty plea.  Convicted.
Court imposes a fine of $900.00 plus costs, total $2,147.00 to be paid by 02-12-17 or forty-two (42) days jail for failure to pay.  Alcohol assessment.  Thirty-six (36) month license revocation.  Ignition interlock for period of revocation.  Seven (7) months Manitowoc County Jail, Huber Law, commencing immediately.  Court authorizes transfer to Walworth County Jail.  If defendant is eligible for electronic monitoring and meets guidelines, Court deems defendant eligible.  Court authorizes out-of-county and out-of-state travel for employment and counseling purposes.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Minutes.
